questions.text: What is the main principle of flipped learning?
options: Students watch lectures at home and do homework in class
Students work independently at all times
questions.explain: Flipped learning moves lecture content outside the classroom (typically through videos) so class time can be used for active, collaborative learning.

questions.text: What is a key benefit of flipped classrooms?
questions.explain: Flipped classrooms allow for more active learning, discussion, and personalized support during class time, leading to higher student engagement.

questions.text: Which is NOT an active learning strategy?
questions.explain: Passive lecture listening is a traditional approach. Active learning requires students to engage, discuss, and apply knowledge.
